title.quote: Echoes in the Noise: Posterior Samples of Faint Galaxy Surface Brightness Profiles with Score-Based Likelihoods and Priors

extractions.description: Examining galaxy population structures by overcoming noise and point spread function issues in astronomical images using score-based likelihood approaches and diffusion model priors for Bayesian analysis.

type.justification: The paper presents and demonstrates a method for analyzing astronomical images using practical data from the Hubble Space Telescope and the James Webb Space Telescope.
type.quote: Here we present a framework which combines recent advances in score-based likelihood characterization and diffusion model priors to perform a Bayesian analysis of image deconvolution.

name.justification: The paper focuses on methods for improving the analysis of astronomical images through computational methods.
name.quote: Here we present a framework which combines recent advances in score-based likelihood characterization and diffusion model priors to perform a Bayesian analysis of image deconvolution.

name.justification: The paper proposes a framework specifically aimed at deconvoluting images from telescopes.
name.quote: Examining the detailed structure of galaxy populations provides valuable insights into their formation and evolution mechanisms. Significant barriers to such analysis are the non-trivial noise properties of real astronomical images and the point spread function (PSF) which blurs structure.

name.justification: The paper states that a U-net architecture is used for learning the score of the noise distribution.
name.quote: In summary, the objective function minimizes a weighted sum of Fisher divergences between the output of a neural network with a U-net architecture and the score of a Gaussian perturbation kernel, p(xt | x0 ) = N (xt | µ(t)x0 , σ 2 (t)1n×n ), both parameterized by the time variable t ∈ [0, 1] of an SDE.
